data.title: Hard to find - easy to love!
data.text: The lemonade served with a stick of sugar cane is worth the trip, but the food here knocks it out of the park. I haven't tried every dish here, but every dish I've tried has been delicious. A little tricky to find since it's so small, but well worth the effort.

data.title: Absolutely delicious food and great service!
data.text: My family and I have been here a few times while we were in town. We always get great service even when they are busy (which seems to be a lot!). The food is definitely what we were looking for. We are originally from California where there's lots of good mexican food...now we found a great place here!

data.title: Best Flan in Mesa
data.text: The food is typical Mexican, but the flan is what makes this place really stand out. Heavy and dense with lots of caramel, really great flan

data.title: Fresh and inexpensive
data.text: This is a casual eatery.  Order and pay at the counter and they bring your food to your table.  Salsa was spicy and fresh.  I had a combo plate with taco, tostada and enchilada under $10.  Taco and tostada did not have sauce so great if you can't handle spicy but I topped mine with the salsa for a bit of a kick.  Taco/tostada shells were freshly made.  Flan was a bit overcooked but caramel sauce was excellent.  I will come back.

data.title: Still awesome
data.text: Met my wife and son today for lunch.  It was still busy, as most great local places are... Police, city employees etc.  The food was as good as ever.  My wife loves the tacos, my son loves seafood burritos but said the shrimp was a little too spicy for him.  He still are most of it.  Me, I always get the number 6 with the tostada on a separate plate so it doesn't get soggy.  Always an amazing lunch.  If you want great Mexican food in Mesa, head to Mango's!!

data.title: Husband and neighbors favorite lunch spot
data.text: Great Mesa lunch spot.  My 90+ neighbor eats there at least 2 times per month with us.They both order tacos and I like the fish taco

data.title: fast, authentic, delicious
data.text: Another spot close to my place of business. We eat here regularly and love it! Tacos, salads, burritos, street tacos, you name it - it's good.

data.title: Dinner out
data.text: We showed up not knowing there was a bike show happening, we got in, got our food ordered and had a seat. Even busy as they we got our drinks, chips and dinner in no time, to top it off, it was good! More than I could eat, I will be making a return visit when I come back to Mesa.

data.title: Fantastic food, reasonable prices
data.text: FANTASTIC food!  Reasonable prices.  Chips & Salsa absolutely the best!  I had the street tacos, husband had the Carne Asada burrito, another in our group had the Tilapia tacos, and one had the Killer Burrito w/shredded beef.  All thought it was great - the only down side is that we couldn't get Margaritas to go with our meal. Oh well, not that big of a deal.  Would definitely return again next time we travel through Mesa.  :-)

data.title: Mangos
data.text:
I joined friends for lunch.  It is a small restaurant with outside & inside eating.  

Food was very very good, fresh & nicely.  presented.  Authentic Mexican food.  Service was quick.  Fresh fruit drinks also exceptional.  It has a reputation for consistently good food.

data.title: So good!
data.text: Just had lunch at Mangos.  Have never heard of the place, but we were in the area and saw people eating outdoors and thought it might be nice to sit and relax for a bit.  It was right at noon and the line inside was a bit long, but within a few minutes we'd ordered and found a table.  The staff brought out chips and salsa while we waited for out food.  The salsa was amazing...a bit of a kick, but not what I would consider hot!  Food came in good time.  I had green corn tamales.  It was amazing.  So glad we had the experience of Mangos.  The staff was friendly, place was clean, and food was good.  Win win!

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: My parents were visiting me from out of town and wanted Mexican food. Mango's is nearby my office so figured we'd give it a shot. I'm glad we did. Service was friendly and helpful, food came quickly and tasted great! Salsa has a kick, as well as the pico de gallo, but not too bad. My mom had shrimp tacos and doesn't like spicy, so I requested sauce on the side. Good thing because that particular sauce was fire-hot! We all enjoyed our food and I will go again. Prices very reasonable as well.

data.title: My favourite lunch time eatery in Mesa
data.text: Doesn't get much better than Mango's for tasty Mexican cuisine. My favourite eatery for lunch in Mesa. Try  Mango's Shrimp salad. Very reasonably priced with large portions. Always busy which is a good sign for any restaurant.

data.title: Followed The Line of People to Great Food
data.text:
We were looking for a place to eat lunch and noticed Mangos Mexican Cafe had a line outside the door.  I've been told to always eat where the people are.  This family restaurant didn't let us down.  The line moved fast and ordering was easy.  They give you an number and bring the food to you at a table you choose.  There is also patio seating outside on the street.  

I had a shredded beef burrito with sour cream and cheese.  It's got to be one of my top five best burritos ever.  I had the burrito as a combo with rice and beans.  The beans were average, but the rice was awesome . . .  and, I never eat the rice!   My wife had hard shell chicken tacos and said they were very tasty.  We shared an order of chips (homemade) with a great salsa.

The staff is friendly and the cost inexpensive.  Since there is no table service, tipping is voluntary. I would eat here again and willingly stand in line to order.  The food is worth the wait.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Our moms wanted chimichanga's they are 78,82. This cute little place on Main Street Mesa was amazing. The food was delicious. The fried ice cream was the BEST! The owner was  so friendly.

data.title: Loved my carne asada burrito!
data.text: Stopped by here to pick up burritos for a ball game.......great burritos!!  This was the best carne asada burrito that I've ever had (according to my tastes).  It had meat with every (and I mean every) bite and the pricing was reasonable.  We also tried the chile relleno.  The tortilla chips and their salsa that they gave with our take out order was good and plenty.  We'll be back most definitely and pass the word on to our friends.

data.title: Great Tamales
data.text: Very small restaurant but very good.   We sat outside which was really nice. They had some of the best tamales I have had in along time. They also have fresh juice.  We had Mango juice which was really good.  My friend had a burrito which she said was also great, and big.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  I will definitely eat there again.

data.title: Me and my significant other
data.text:
Have been eating lunch there at least 
Once a week for six years  always a
Treat  very prompt and friendly service 
Right next to the light rail
Don't need a vehicle to get a great
There

data.title: My mouth is watering.  THE best food I've had in a long time
data.text:
If I didn't live an hour and fifteen minutes away, Mangos Mexican Cafe would be my go to place to eat.  Both my husband and I raved about the food.  The people were super nice and we were able to sit outdoors. 

We went before a concert at the Mesa Center for the Arts.  It was perfect.  Parked in the venues ramp and walked back to the restaurant. 

Next time we are in Mesa or close, we'll swing by.  Not fancy but the food was fantastic.

data.title: Great Mexican!!
data.text: Visited here after a trip to the Natural History Museum nearby. Rated highly and well deserved. Fast friendly service and great Mexican food. I had shredded beef quesadilla.
